# GitSorted — Full LLM Reference

> Task lists, shopping lists, and notes backed by git.

GitSorted is a mobile app (iOS/Android) that stores data as plain JSON files inside standard git repositories on the user's device. Each list is a standalone git repo that can optionally sync to any HTTPS git remote (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Gitea, Azure Repos, AWS CodeCommit, or self-hosted).

This document is the complete reference for LLMs and automated tools interacting with GitSorted repositories.

---

## Repository Structure

Each list is a git repo with this layout:

```
<repo>/
├── .git/               # Standard git internals
├── metadata.json       # Project metadata (type, labels, conflict strategy)
└── items/
    ├── <uuid>.json     # One JSON file per item
    ├── <uuid>.json
    └── ...
```

Rules:
- Items are stored as flat files in `items/`, named `<uuid-v4>.json`
- No nested directories inside `items/`
- Default branch: `main`
- The app only syncs a single branch per repository

---

## metadata.json

The metadata file at the repository root describes the project configuration.

```json
{
  "projectType": "todo",
  "labels": ["bug", "feature", "urgent"],
  "conflictStrategy": "last-write-wins"
}
```

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| projectType | string | yes | One of `todo`, `shopping`, `notes`, or `generic` |
| labels | string[] | no | Canonical list of all label names. Defaults to [] |
| conflictStrategy | string | no | `last-write-wins` (default), `remote-wins`, or `local-wins` |

JSON Schema: https://gitsorted.app/schemas/metadata.schema.json

---

## Item Types

### Task Item (projectType: "todo")

Full-featured items with priorities, deadlines, reminders, labels, and notes.

```json
{
  "id": "a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890",
  "createdAt": "2026-01-15T10:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2026-01-15T14:30:00.000Z",
  "completed": false,
  "shortDescription": "Buy groceries",
  "listOrder": 2,
  "priority": "medium",
  "deadline": "2026-01-16T17:00:00.000Z",
  "reminders": ["1d", "1h", "0"],
  "notes": "Check the pantry before going",
  "labels": ["errands"],
  "url": "https://example.com"
}
```

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| id | string | yes | UUID v4. Must match filename without .json |
| createdAt | string | yes | ISO 8601. Set once at creation, never changed |
| updatedAt | string | yes | ISO 8601. Updated on every mutation |
| completed | boolean | yes | Whether the item is done |
| shortDescription | string | yes | The item's title or brief summary |
| listOrder | number | yes | Sort position (lower = earlier). Must be >= 0 |
| completedAt | string | no | ISO 8601. Set when completed becomes true |
| priority | string | no | `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `critical` |
| deadline | string | no | ISO 8601 timestamp for the due date |
| reminders | string[] | no | Deadline-relative offset codes (see below) |
| notes | string | no | Freeform text content |
| labels | string[] | no | Tags. Each should exist in metadata.json labels |
| url | string | no | A related URL |

#### Reminder offset codes

Reminders are stored as offset codes relative to the deadline, NOT as absolute timestamps:

| Code | Meaning | Milliseconds before deadline |
|------|---------|------------------------------|
| `"0"` | At deadline | 0 |
| `"15m"` | 15 minutes before | 900,000 |
| `"1h"` | 1 hour before | 3,600,000 |
| `"1d"` | 1 day before | 86,400,000 |
| `"1w"` | 1 week before | 604,800,000 |

The app computes notification trigger times as `deadline - offset`. Reminders require a deadline to be set; if the deadline is cleared, reminders are also cleared.

JSON Schema: https://gitsorted.app/schemas/task-item.schema.json

### Shopping Item (projectType: "shopping")

Simpler items for shopping lists. No deadline or reminders.

```json
{
  "id": "f9e8d7c6-b5a4-3210-fedc-ba0987654321",
  "createdAt": "2026-02-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2026-02-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "completed": true,
  "completedAt": "2026-02-01T09:15:00.000Z",
  "shortDescription": "Milk (2%)",
  "listOrder": 0,
  "labels": ["dairy"]
}
```

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| id | string | yes | UUID v4 |
| createdAt | string | yes | ISO 8601 |
| updatedAt | string | yes | ISO 8601 |
| completed | boolean | yes | Whether purchased/checked off |
| shortDescription | string | yes | Item name |
| listOrder | number | yes | Sort position |
| completedAt | string | no | ISO 8601 |
| priority | string | no | `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `critical` |
| notes | string | no | Freeform text |
| labels | string[] | no | Tags |
| url | string | no | Related URL |

JSON Schema: https://gitsorted.app/schemas/shopping-item.schema.json

### Note Item (projectType: "notes")

Markdown-based notes. No completed/priority/deadline fields.

```json
{
  "id": "11223344-5566-7788-99aa-bbccddeeff00",
  "createdAt": "2026-03-01T12:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedAt": "2026-03-01T15:45:00.000Z",
  "listOrder": 0,
  "title": "Meeting Notes",
  "body": "# Sprint Planning\n\n- Discussed roadmap\n- Assigned tasks",
  "labels": ["work"]
}
```

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| id | string | yes | UUID v4 |
| createdAt | string | yes | ISO 8601 |
| updatedAt | string | yes | ISO 8601 |
| listOrder | number | yes | Sort position |
| title | string | no | Note title |
| body | string | no | Markdown content |
| labels | string[] | no | Tags |

JSON Schema: https://gitsorted.app/schemas/note-item.schema.json

---

## Working With GitSorted Repos

### Creating items
1. Generate a UUID v4 (e.g. `a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890`)
2. Create `items/<uuid>.json` with all required fields
3. Set `id` to match the filename (without `.json`)
4. Set `createdAt` and `updatedAt` to the current ISO 8601 time
5. Set `listOrder` to max existing listOrder + 1
6. Commit with any message (prefix with `GitSorted:` to match convention)
7. Push

### Editing items
1. Read the existing JSON file
2. Modify desired fields
3. Update `updatedAt` to the current ISO 8601 time
4. If setting `completed: true`, also set `completedAt` to current time
5. Commit and push

### Deleting items
1. Delete the JSON file from `items/`
2. Commit and push
3. Note: if the app edited the item since your last sync, the edit-wins strategy will restore it

### Adding labels
1. Read `metadata.json`
2. Add the new label string to the `labels` array
3. Commit and push
4. The app union-merges labels on sync, so there's no risk of losing labels

### Bulk operations
For adding many items at once, create all JSON files, then make a single commit. The app will pick up all new items on the next sync.

---

## Conflict Resolution

### Item files (items/*.json)
Resolved using the `conflictStrategy` in metadata.json:
- **last-write-wins** (default): compare `updatedAt` timestamps; the later one wins
- **remote-wins**: always keep the remote version
- **local-wins**: always keep the local version

### metadata.json
- `labels`: union-merged (all labels from both sides are kept)
- `projectType`: remote value is used

### Delete vs edit
Edit always wins. If one side deletes an item and the other edits it, the edited version is kept. Content preservation takes priority.

### Non-item files
Standard git merge behavior.

---

## Commit Conventions

All app auto-commits are prefixed with `GitSorted:`:
- `GitSorted: update N file(s)` — standard item changes
- `GitSorted: merge resolved` — after automatic conflict resolution

The app ignores commit messages entirely; only file content matters. You can make your own commits with any message format.

---

## Supported Git Providers

GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Gitea, Azure Repos, AWS CodeCommit, and any self-hosted HTTPS git server. Authentication uses Personal Access Tokens stored in the device's secure storage.

---

## App Features

- **Task lists**: priorities (low/medium/high/critical), deadlines, deadline-relative reminders with push notifications, custom labels, notes, URLs, sort by priority/date/deadline
- **Shopping lists**: quick check-off items with optional priorities and labels
- **Notes**: markdown editor with live preview, toolbar (bold, italic, headings, lists, links), auto-save
- **Sync**: automatic push (15s debounce) and pull (on launch/foreground/manual), per-project conflict resolution
- **Theme**: light mode, dark mode, and system-follow
- **Languages**: 36 languages
- **Pro**: unlimited lists, items, and credentials ($4.99 one-time)

---
